medical_history.chief_complaint: New onset abdominal distension, pain, nausea, and vomiting.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began after the patient finished an evening shift at work, feeling malaise and lack of appetite. He had a semi-formed dark bowel movement, then awoke at 5 AM with abdominal pain, firmness, and nausea. He vomited once with undigested food. The pain was described as a dull but intense band radiating from the midline epigastrium around the flanks towards the back. He has not been passing gas today.
medical_history.past_medical_history: Obesity, diabetes mellitus type 2 (DM2), gastroesophageal reflux disease (GERD), hyperlipidemia. Prior surgeries include partial gastrectomy and several surgeries following traumatic events.
medical_history.family_history: Mother died of Alzheimer's and abdominal aortic aneurysm (AAA), father died of congestive heart failure (CHF), one sibling died of renal cell carcinoma (RCC) at a young age, others are healthy. No family history of DM2.
